['The craft they built for this expedition was called the Ra II.', 'Design and construction: The Ra II was designed and built by Thor Heyerdahl and his crew in Peru, using techniques and materials that would have been available to ancient cultures', 'Size: The Ra II was approximately 16 meters (52 feet) long and 4 meters (13 feet) wide', 'Weight: The Ra II weighed around 20 tons, including the weight of the crew and supplies.', 'Speed: The Ra II was designed to travel at a speed of around 5-6 knots (9-11 km/h or 5.6-6.8 mph), which is relatively slow compared to modern sailing vessels.', 'Crew: The Ra II had a crew of five people, including Heyerdahl and his navigator, Edgar Rice.', 'Route: The Ra II set off from the Peruvian port of Callao on April 28, 1947, and traveled across the Pacific Ocean to the Marquesas Islands, which are located in French Polynesia', 'Success: Despite the challenges they faced, the Ra II successfully reached the Marquesas Islands on July 30, 1947, proving that it was possible to travel across the Pacific Ocean using only the materials and technologies available to ancient cultures.']
